channel.title: News, Politics, Opinion, Commentary, and Analysis
channel.description: In-depth reporting, commentary on breaking news, political analysis, and opinion from The New Yorker.

item.title: How Chinese Students Experience America
item.description: COVID, guns, anti-Asian violence, and diplomatic relations have complicated the ambitions of the some three hundred thousand college students who come to the U.S. each year.
item.dc:creator: Peter Hessler

item.title: The Hottest Restaurant in France Is an All-You-Can-Eat Buffet
item.description: Les Grands Buffets features a seven-tiered lobster tower, a chocolate fountain, and only what it considers traditional French food. Gourmands are willing to wait months for a table.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Collins

item.title: So You Think You’ve Been Gaslit
item.description: What happens when a niche clinical concept becomes a ubiquitous cultural diagnosis.
item.dc:creator: Leslie Jamison

item.title: The Brazilian Special-Forces Unit Fighting to Save the Amazon
item.description: As miners ravage Yanomami lands, combat-trained environmentalists work to root them out.
item.dc:creator: Jon Lee Anderson

item.title: What Have Fourteen Years of Conservative Rule Done to Britain?
item.description: Living standards have fallen. The country is exhausted by constant drama. But the U.K. can’t move on from the Tories without facing up to the damage that has occurred.
item.dc:creator: Sam Knight

item.title: Joe Biden’s Texas Showdown
item.description: In some ways, Greg Abbott, as the governor of a border state, poses a more acute political problem for the President than Donald Trump does.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Blitzer

item.title: This Easter, Is Christianity Still Promulgating Antisemitism?

item.title: What the Abortion-Pill Battle Is Really About

item.title: The Brutal Conditions Facing Palestinian Prisoners

item.title: Why Biden’s Floating Pier Is Unlikely to Meet Gaza’s Needs
item.description: A veteran humanitarian on what it will take to feed civilians in the region.

item.title: The Trump Stock Bubble: How Long Will It Last?

item.dc:creator: John Cassidy

item.title: Why the Biden Administration Is Suing Apple and Investigating Big Grocers
item.description: A new generation of trustbusters is trying to use anti-monopoly laws to roll back concentrations of economic power.

item.title: Alicia Keys Returns to Her Roots with Her New Musical, “Hell’s Kitchen”
item.description: In her musical opening on Broadway, Keys tells a story very much like her own life—but don’t call it autobiographical. Plus, Rhiannon Giddens on the Black roots of country music.

item.title: It’s Shohei Ohtani Season in L.A.
